BE11:22am

With marketing and price investments planned in H2 (particularly in France and Germany), together with the step up in ROW and US demand already witnessed (albeit the latter clearly not visible in Q2 performance), management remains confident that it will meet FY 19
guidance, which is unchanged. We nevertheless think this statement will be met with disappointment, particularly in the context of the stock having rallied +41% ytd, and expect the shares to move lower today. We continue to believe Asos is a structural winner, but in the very near term, with some still unanswered questions on recent performance, we would not chase any share price weakness

red from that its clear the eu prefers a WA and moving on, rather than a 2 year extension and the hope of something changing. said offer wont be ready this side of eu summit apparently.
Blank canvas Wood Group, please, if you have a chance BE.
Flaneur @Mouselet @Pharma - I couldnt call it, but it will certainly be a shadow referendum
BE11:22am

And Goldman.

BE11:23am

KPIs: active customers +16%, average basket value -2%, average order frequency +4%.
Overall, we think sales growth should accelerate in 2H19 as growth in the US reverses, although the slowdown in Europe needs more clarification. Increase in Retail gross margin in 2Q19 is positive.
Guidance: ASOS reiterated its guidance of c.15% sales growth, Retail gross margin c.-150bps, EBIT margin of c.2% and capex c.£200m for FY19E. ASOS expects net debt of c.£50m for FY19E.
Implications: Other things equal, we expect Thomson Reuters consensus for FY19 PBT of c.£55mn (-45% yoy) to remain unchanged.
Valuation: Our 12-month PT is 4,000p. Our price target is derived from a combination of a DCF-based fundamental valuation (weighted 85%) and an M&A valuation (weighted 15%), reflecting ASOS’s rank of ‘2’ on our sector M&A framework. Our M&A valuation remains based on 45x FY19E EV/EBITDA, in line with historical sector transactions.

PBateman asos have a tough gig against Zalando on the continent, was skiing in switz last week and Zal are advertising absolutely everywhere. Every youtube ad, every OOH ad

BE11:25am

Conclusion: ASOS 2Q19 sales have surprised with no pick up in sales growth from the disappointing 1Q19, with 2Q19 revenue +13% or +11% ex FX vs cons/JEF +15%. In addition, gross margin surprised by being up +40bps rather than down (cons -155bps/JEFe -200bps). Company says, however, that it will invest in 2H19E, particularly in France and Germany, which have disappointed, and so no change to FY19E guidance of +15% sales growth and gross margin -150bps leading to an EBIT margin of just 2%. With the stock up 37% since the profit warning, investors will have been hoping for an acceleration in sales growth.
Details: ASOS has reported total retail sales +13% to £641m (+11% ex FX), in line with 1Q19. Within this, UK retail sales rose 14%, a slowdown from 19% in 1Q (though still above market growth) and international sales rose 13% or 9% ex FX. The US has disappointed with a decline of 3% ex FX (Atlanta DC issues) and the EU also slowed against 1Q19 to +8% ex FX. RoW is the only improver qoq.
